snippet: Four hundred Syrians who were trying to fly to Turkey were stopped at the Beirut airport on Friday and were being forced to return to Damascus instead.
abstract: Four hundred Syrians are forced to return to Syria after being stopped at airport in Beirut as they made their way to Turkey because of new Turkish visa regulations; incident show number of ways out of Syria are dwindling for those who wish to flee civil war.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul, and Rana F. Sweis from Amman.

lead_paragraph: Four hundred Syrians who were trying to fly to Turkey were stopped at the Beirut airport on Friday and were being forced to return to Damascus instead.

headline.main: Hundreds of Syrians Are Turned Back at Beirut Airport
headline.print_headline: Hundreds of Syrians Trying to Reach Turkey Are Turned Back at the Beirut Airport

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
